graph

Class Graph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Graph<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the value of the nodes that will be in this graph

    public class Graph<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Graph class uses the Node class and the Edge class to a create a Graph it is public and implements has BFS and DFS method that returns an iterator of the Graph in DFS order or BFS order the first node is the root node and can't be removed. It is up to user to make sure that any node added is only used in one Graph.
    Version:
    1.0 July 26, 2016
    Author:
    Arturo Muller

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph(Node<T> rootNode)
      Class constructor specifying the Node that will be the root of the Graph this Node is not removable once chosen and can't be null.

      Removes the edge that connects the two nodes
      void removeNode(Node<T> node)
